definition: Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: A man was in a bad accident and was injured.
sentences.chinese: 有一個人遭遇了一場嚴重的意外事故並受了重傷。

sentences.english: He had little recollection of the accident.
sentences.chinese: 那宗意外事故他幾乎完全記不起了。

sentences.english: C- lists were published the day after the train accident.
sentences.chinese: 傷亡名單在火車意外事故的第二天就公佈了。

sentences.english: He got a few cuts and scratches in the accident.
sentences.chinese: 他在意外事故中被割破和碰傷了幾處地方。

sentences.english: Italian chocolate tycoon Pietro Ferrero has died in an accident in South Africa, a company spokesman has said.
sentences.chinese: 意大利巧克力巨頭費列羅死於南非的一次意外事故。

sentences.english: It also puts you at higher risk for workplace accidents.
sentences.chinese: 厭倦感甚至會使你在工作上出現意外事故的風險更高。

sentences.english: Sometimes, accidents can be a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 有時，意外事故也可能是件好事。

sentences.english: However, fate occurs and Evelyn is killed in a freak accident.
sentences.chinese: 然而，命運發生了，伊夫林在一次意外事故中喪生。

sentences.english: Even without any ill intent, accidents will happen at sea.
sentences.chinese: 即使沒有壞的意圖，海上也會出現意外事故。

sentences.english: "No, " Clinton utters , "That would be a violent ACCIDENT .
sentences.chinese: “不，”克林頓說，“這是個嚴重的意外事故。”

sentences.english: if the citizen's whereabouts have been unknown for two years after the date of an accident in which he was involved.
sentences.chinese: 因意外事故下落不明，從事故發生之日起滿二年的。

sentences.english: Eg The accident happened quite recently.
sentences.chinese: 那次意外事故不長前剛發生。

sentences.english: The Israeli Defence Forces said it was an accident, and that she was killed by falling debris.
sentences.chinese: 而以色列國防軍則說她死於廢墟坍塌，純屬意外事故。

sentences.english: He was seriously maimed in an accident.
sentences.chinese: 他在一次意外事故中受重傷而殘廢。

sentences.english: Accidents are often caused by drivers who try to cut in.
sentences.chinese: 司機超車搶擋常常造成意外事故。

sentences.english: He became a cripple as a result of the accident.
sentences.chinese: 他因爲意外事故而成了跛子。

definition: to injure oneself in a fall
to happen/to occur/to take place/to break out
to lead to death/to result in death
